item.title: AWS PostgreSQL RDS - remaining connection slots are reserved error
item.description: Today I had a problem with PostgreSQL connection, both my application and psql tool returned an error: FATAL: remaining connection slots are reserved for non-replication superuser connections The PostgreSQL server was running on the db.t1.micro RDS instance and the ‘Current activity’ column showed ‘22 connections’ and a red line which should represent a connection limit was far away from the 22 value. Here is how it looked: . And this connection information is actually misleading - it shows 22 connections and it looks like around 30% consumed.
